post.body: Yay, this is pretty unusual and interesting =)
Something is wrong with images on ZeroMe. They aren't downloading properly. IDK if this is my Internet connection problems, or ZeroNet, or ZeroMe.

I was thinking about my pet project backend recently.
First I took Scalatra for hosting HTTP server. Pretty useful and customizable library it is. But then I needed some multithread logic and a websockets server in addition.
So I started looking at Akka. Actor-based model is very handy for my use case, and stream based websocket server is nice too.
But if I take Akka, why not use Akka-HTTP for HTTP server? I looked some benchmarks and it appeared that Akka's HTTP implementation is faster than Scalatra's (and many other frameworks too).
And so I ended rewriting my whole project to Akka stack.
=)
Something feels strange with the numbers, but can't put my finger on what's wrong...

What do you think about this?
[p2p social networking with Rotonde & Beaker](https://louis.center/p2p-social-networking/)

comment.body: @Woodsfirezyj: I have no idea what you wrote, but hello =)

@Ekaterina: yeah, I think you are right about peer to peer connections. I'm zeronet newbie =) Just downloaded zeronet bundle and started it, without Tor or anything - just pure zeronet node. And my port is closed also, so this may cause some troubles.
@Ekaterina: Tadah! I've opened my router port, and now I'm able to download most of images. That's pretty cool, thank you =)
@Ekaterina: that was exactly my thoughts too! ZeroNet looks lovely designed and is very easy to use - all this leaves a very good first impression.
It works. A little bit slow, but works. =)
